PageTitle: nat syslog descriptive format flexible template
FuncDef:
The nat syslog descriptive format flexible template command binds a NAT flexible log template to NAT flow or user syslogs as flexible logs to make the template take effect.
The undo nat syslog descriptive format flexible template command unbinds a NAT flexible log template from NAT flow or user syslogs and restores the default format.
By default, NAT syslogs are in type3 format.
CLIs: nat syslog descriptive format { type3 | flexible template { session | user } }
nat syslog descriptive format { type3 | flexible template session }
undo nat syslog descriptive format { type3 | flexible template { session | user } }
undo nat syslog descriptive format { type3 | flexible template session }

ParaDef.Info:
Sends syslog information in type3 format to a syslog host. This is the default format.
-

Examples: [~HUAWEI] nat syslog descriptive format flexible template session

<134> 1 2010-11-28T18:52:12.33Z 10.137.228.131 - - NAT444userbased - %%01SEC/6/BIND(l): A initial portrange is assigned, in nat444 scene. privateip='172.31.1.91' publicip='172.30.1.6' publicportrange='33792~34047' time='2010-11-28 18:52:12'
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After configuring a flexible NAT log template, you can run the nat syslog descriptive format flexible template command to make the flexible log template take effect.
Prerequisites
Flexible log template has been created.
Follow-up Procedure
After running the nat syslog descriptive format flexible template command to make the flexible log template take effect for NAT logs, you can run the display syslog flexible template command to view the log format in the flexible log template.
